entry.title: Anthony Scaramucci: Bitcoin is due for a correction

media:group.media:title: Anthony Scaramucci: Bitcoin is due for a correction
media:group.media:description: Anthony Scaramucci tells CNN's Alison Kosik that Bitcoin's best days are ahead, but the ride will be volatile. He also weighs in on Trump and the future of the GOP. #CNN #News #Business

entry.title: These restaurant owners don't know how long they can hang on

media:group.media:title: These restaurant owners don't know how long they can hang on
media:group.media:description: As winter nears, restaurant owners are waiting on Washington DC's long delayed stimulus bill to help them survive. #CNN #News #Business

entry.title: How Jimmy Carter's love of music played into his career

media:group.media:title: How Jimmy Carter's love of music played into his career
media:group.media:description:
An exclusive panel discusses how President Carter’s deep love of all forms of music has been both a feature and an asset for his storied life and career following an advance, sneak-peak screening of the CNN Film, “Jimmy Carter, Rock & Roll President.” Presented in partnership with the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame.
Featuring: Wolf Blitzer, CNN anchor Chip Carter, son of President Carter Nwaka Onwusa, Vice President of Curatorial Affairs & Chief Curator at The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Bishop Michael Curry
#CNN #News

entry.title: Russia's Navalny says he is 'sure' Putin ordered agents to trail him before poisoning

media:group.media:title: Russia's Navalny says he is 'sure' Putin ordered agents to trail him before poisoning
media:group.media:description:
Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny speaks to CNN's Christiane Amanpour about returning to Russia after being poisoned and his plans to continue fighting for political reform.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Keilar calls out GOP members who won't acknowledge Biden's win

media:group.media:title: Keilar calls out GOP members who won't acknowledge Biden's win
media:group.media:description:
CNN's Brianna Keilar talks about the many GOP officials who said they would acknowledge Joe Biden as president-elect after the Electoral College voted and have yet to recognize the win a day after the vote.
#CNN #News

entry.title: CITIZEN by CNN: Key takeaways from the 2020 US election

media:group.media:title: CITIZEN by CNN: Key takeaways from the 2020 US election
media:group.media:description: A CNN panel discusses the US Electoral College vote that affirmed President-elect Joe Biden's victory, the upcoming Senate runoff in Georgia and stimulus talks amid the coronavirus pandemic. #CNN #News

entry.title: The one award Donald Trump is obsessed with winning

media:group.media:title: The one award Donald Trump is obsessed with winning
media:group.media:description:
In mid-December, Time magazine announced its “Person of the year.” Or, really, “Persons of the Year” as President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris were named the winners. In the latest episode of The Point, CNN’s Chris Cillizza explains why this announcement really stings for President Donald Trump.
SOURCES AND FURTHER READING:
Joe Biden and Kamala Harris named Time Person of the Year https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/10/media/joe-biden-kamala-harris-time-person-of-the-year/index.html
Who Will Be TIME's Person of the Year for 2020? See the Shortlist https://time.com/5919489/time-person-of-the-year-shortlist-2020/
A Time magazine with Trump on the cover hangs in his golf clubs. It’s fake https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/a-time-magazine-with-trump-on-the-cover-hangs-in-his-golf-clubs-its-fake/2017/06/27/0adf96de-5850-11e7-ba90-f5875b7d1876_story.html
The Silence Breakers https://time.com/time-person-of-the-year-2017-silence-breakers/
The Guardians https://time.com/person-of-the-year-2018-the-guardians-choice/
The ‘very fine people’ at Charlottesville: Who were they? https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/05/08/very-fine-people-charlottesville-who-were-they-2/
About me: I was named "best dressed" in 7th grade. That, along with being CNN's editor at large and author of the daily "Point" newsletter are my proudest achievements. Look for me here every Tuesday and Thursday to find out what’s really going down in politics.
CREDITS Writer: Chris Cillizza Producer: Allison Gordon The Point Editor: Leigh Munsil Video Editor: Michelle Cho
Follow Chris on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/cillizzac/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/cillizzacnn Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/chris.cillizza/
Subscribe to The Point newsletter: https://www.cnn.com/specials/politics/the-point-with-chris-cillizza?source=Point_Youtube.
#CNN #Cillizza #Trump

media:group.media:title: SE Cupp: Partisanship is profitable
media:group.media:description: In this week’s episode of “What Comes Next?,” SE Cupp discusses how the new administration can start to foster unity among Americans with former Obama administration official Van Jones and Republican strategist Alice Stewart. https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/15/opinions/surprising-ways-unite-divided-america-van-jones/index.html #CNN #News

entry.title: Surgeon General: This is going to be the hardest vaccine distribution in history

media:group.media:title: Surgeon General: This is going to be the hardest vaccine distribution in history
media:group.media:description:
Surgeon General Dr. Jerome Adams describes the milestone of seeing Americans getting Covid-19 vaccines as "a shot of hope", but says people should continue washing their hands and practicing social distancing.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Watch Joe Biden's full address to the nation after Electoral College reaffirms his victory

media:group.media:title: Watch Joe Biden's full address to the nation after Electoral College reaffirms his victory
media:group.media:description:
After the Electoral College affirmed his win, President-elect Joe Biden addressed the American people and slammed attempts by President Trump and Republicans to overturn the 2020 presidential election results.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Electoral College formally affirms Biden's presidential win

media:group.media:title: Electoral College formally affirms Biden's presidential win
media:group.media:description:
President-elect Joe Biden has received enough electoral votes to officially clinch the presidency, a major milestone that he reached when California's electors awarded him the state's 55 electoral votes.
#CNN #News

entry.title: US crosses horrific milestone mid-interview. See Azar's response

media:group.media:title: US crosses horrific milestone mid-interview. See Azar's response
media:group.media:description:
More than 300,000 people in the US have now died from Covid-19. CNN's Jake Tapper asks HHS secretary Alex Azar why the US is struggling to deal with this pandemic.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Rep. Mitchell says he's leaving GOP: I've had enough

media:group.media:title: Rep. Mitchell says he's leaving GOP: I've had enough
media:group.media:description: In an exclusive interview, Rep. Paul Mitchell, Republican of Michigan, tells CNN's Jake Tapper that his disappointment with President Trump's efforts to overturn the results of the election have led him to request that the Clerk of the House change his party affiliation to "independent."

entry.title: Tapper explains CNN's electoral college vote coverage

media:group.media:title: Tapper explains CNN's electoral college vote coverage
media:group.media:description:
CNN's Jake Tapper, Dana Bash and Abby Phillip discuss why CNN is covering the electoral college differently in 2020 and President Trump's attack on the 2020 election.
#CNN #News #jake tapper

entry.title: CNN investigation uncovers tailing of Alexey Navalny prior to poisoning

media:group.media:title: CNN investigation uncovers tailing of Alexey Navalny prior to poisoning
media:group.media:description: CNN joins an investigation by the group Bellingcat that has pieced together how the Russian Security Service followed Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny and his team throughout a trip to Siberia just prior to his poisoning in August 2020. CNN's Clarissa Ward reports. #CNN #News
